You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that uses Azure Active Directory Domain Services (Azure AD DS).

You have the following host pool:

• Name: Pool1
• Type: Personal
• Number of session hosts: 5

You plan to deploy two new session hosts to Pool1.

What should you do before you deploy the session hosts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Create a registration key.

Creating a registration key is necessary to join the new session hosts to the existing host pool. This key is used during the setup of the new session hosts to register them with the host pool, ensuring they are properly integrated into your Azure Virtual Desktop environment.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains a pooled host pool named Pool1. Pool1 contains five session hosts.

You plan to deploy two apps named App1 and App2. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• All the session hosts must contain both apps.
• All users must connect to a full desktop session.
• Only users in the sales department must be able to use App1.
• Only users in the research department must be able to use App2.

You need to ensure that the users in each department can see only their assigned app when they connect to Pool1.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
They are using full desktop - Should be A (FSLogix masking), to control which applications are visible to the specific users/groups

Selected Answer: A
FSLogix Application masking, because they musst use a full desktop session

Selected Answer: A
FSLogix Application masking

Another discrepancy with the answer that Exam Topics is saying is the correct one. There are a lot of discrepancies on these questions. Is Exam Topics going to correct these errors, or at least provide a justification for why their provided answer is different?

Selected Answer: A
A. FSLogix application masking

FSLogix application masking allows you to control which applications are visible to users based on group membership. This way, you can install both App1 and App2 on all session hosts, but only users in the sales department will see App1, and only users in the research department will see App2. This approach meets all your requirements and minimizes administrative effort.

A
Using FSLogix application masking allows specific applications to be visible to only authorized users. In this scenario, it enables App1 to be visible only to the sales department and App2 to only the research department.

RemoteApp application groups are typically used to publish specific applications directly to users rather than providing a full desktop session. However, the requirements in your scenario specify that all users must connect to a full desktop session while only seeing their department-specific apps

comments.content: Yeah I would go with 2 subscriptions. "What should you recommend?" We should always recommend MS best practices. If we had a pre-req saying minimize admin effort, then it might be 1 sub.

This one is tricky. For exam purposes, the usual “official” answer is just one subscription covering both internal and external users. While Microsoft’s docs sometimes mention separate subscriptions to help isolate or report on external‐user billing, it’s not strictly required for licensing or for meeting typical “minimize costs” requirements.

The recommendation from Microsoft is to use a separate subscription for the per-user access pricing

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains a host pool.

The host pool contains 100 session hosts that run Windows 10 on general-purpose virtual machines.

You plan to implement Quality of Service (QoS) for the deployment.

What should you do first?

choices.B: Switch to a high-performance computing (HPC) virtual machine.
choices.D: Upgrade all the session hosts to Windows 11.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Implement RDP Shortpath

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/rdp-quality-of-service-qos#qos-implementation-checklist

Selected Answer: C
C. Implement RDP Shortpath.

RDP Shortpath improves the connection quality by enabling direct connectivity between the client and the session host, which is essential for implementing QoS policies effectively. This will help manage and prioritize network traffic for RDP sessions, ensuring a better user experience.

Service: Image templates
Image templates are used within Azure Image Builder to define the configuration and steps needed to create a custom image (golden image). Azure Image Builder requires image templates to specify parameters, source image, customization steps, and output location.

Identity: Managed1
Managed1 is the recommended identity type to grant permissions to Azure resources securely without needing credentials, especially for automated tasks like image creation with Azure Image Builder. Managed identities are ideal for Azure Image Builder since they can be assigned the necessary permissions to access resources in a controlled and secure way.
